comments.body: It could just be that you add dye to the painting and depending on which order you do the dye changes what painting will come out in the end
Like the idea, but it's called an ore "vein", not vain.

Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.

Title: “New enchant!”

Text: “A new curse (for armor / armor), Curse of Blue Fire / Curse of Molten Core - allows you to be calmly in the midst of piglins i.e. they run away from you, thereby showing that you are superior to them. Brutus Piglin, of course, will not be afraid of this curse.”

- Translated by Admin
yeessssssssssss
I would have that in Minecraft, but in real life, if I had that I would be barfing in the restroom for hours.
Just imagine combining this with a redstone clock and a bell.
I agree it's annoying how quickly current shields degrade, I would appreciate higher quality shields.

Yes, this would be better and like how wood shields are the base and how each one looks different depending on ore like the basic one would fit with leather and you could put banners to make it not useless, a stone would go with chain meal, iron would be a good fair shield. gold would look nice but weak. diamond could be a fancy one but strong (maybe the shape of a diamond and neatherite would look badass with like a skull on it or something is it fireproof against fire aspect and flame.
I'm in full glowing diamond with an iron and wood shield... :)
Kinda pointless really.
Exactly!
A nice idea. I like how they expanded these blocks to have their own identity rather than the crafting table having everything. Your idea seems really great
A nice idea. I like how they expanded these blocks to have their own identity rather than the crafting table having everything. Your idea seems really great

I feel like many people came to this conclusion on their own, but I definitely see nothing wrong with it. Maybe have only certain arrow heads be “tippable” where they could have potion affects added, but higher damage ones couldn’t?
No
That good idea.
meh

Different materials should be available for the fetching. Each item should have varying accuracy and arrow speed values. The tip should be made from metals, diamond, flint, stone, granite, and various other realistic materials. The material used for the tip should affect durability cost on the bow when the arrow is fired and arrow damage. The type of wood used on the shaft could increase the arrow count produced while negatively impacting the damage and accuracy.

An arrow slot in the inventory may also be useful. It would be above the shield slot.
I was thinking the fletching table could be used to make arrows of (insert potion name here).
arrowing?

I think there should be one slot for an arrow that's already made and another slot for a potion or splash potion and could also hold other items like a wither rose that could make a new type of tipped arrow, a wither arrow. It would be the same with poisonous potatoes which would make poison arrows. I think you could use flowers that you use to make suspicious stew to make tipped arrows like how a poppy in suspicious stew would give you night vision. A poppy combined with an arrow could make a night vision arrow.
Great Idea, I will vote!

making arrows out of more materials, the more expensive the material, the more arrows it makes. with prismarine, blaze rods, ender rods and phantom membrane, it gives the arrows unique properties. The base amount of arrows is four.

Flint-> diamond, iron nugget, gold nugget, netherite scrap, different stone types, or prismarine shards.

Stick-> blaze rod, bone, ender rod, bamboo, sugar cane, or iron bars

Feather-> goat fur, wool, rabbit hide, phantom membrane, string, or leaves

-Consumes one string for each batch of arrows

It could also be used for making fireworks easier and repairing a bow.

yea its kinda pointless because thats basically how you make a arrow unless goats are easier to find than chickens and the drops are more common. But I'm not saying it's bad, It's a great idea but im just saying that it's the same as killing a chicken with flint and a stick.
Kind of pointless. If you were also able to put a feather instead of goat’s fur then it might be easier.
Idk maybe it could be used to repair bows with sticks or string?
Clever, I like the idea of potions, perhaps make it cheaper

"First things first, the fletching table should have a use with the new update's theme. Aka the goats! The Idea is when goats are killed by the player, an item will drop. This new item should be the goats fur."

thats poaching which mojang is strictly against.
Just use 6 trapdoors in a cube.
The recipe should be 6 iron bars at the bottom and 1 chai at the middle top.  You should also be able to carry thge cage with the bird in ti.

Parrots that you make a pet have a hard time keeping up with me when I travel. since fish and axolotls can be put in a  bucket why not a 'cage' for parrots. it takes up one slot in your inventory, non stackable.

I've always seen this struggle as a challenge to be outmaneuvered via clever visual deceptions, so I'm not so sure how much I like this idea, although I appreciate its being brought up for discussion.

Using, the mod Optifine You can achieve the same idea by holding a light source or throwing it on the ground.  However, I believe Mojang tried to team up with Optifine but Optifine declined.  So I want to say that they aren't able to add this into the game unless Optifine approves of this I think.
@rarity41 I'm not talking about dynamic lighting. I'm discussing making any block a light source.
Hmm, okay @karl smink.  Than, you got a vote!  I read the idea wrong.  I apologize.
Title changed accordingly to prevent confusion.
Don't bother with red stone, just provide more light emitting blocks and more importantly light slabs.

I suggest this should work like redstone. Glowstone dust can be placed on top of any block that redstone dust can be placed on. It is invisible but the hitbox can be seen if you hover over it. It emits a light level the same as a torch.

I also think that glowstone blocks, end rods, redstone lamps and sea lanterns should emit more light than a torch. I made a separate suggestion for that.
I think it should emit a light level of 10 like soulfire lights instead of 15 like torchs.

I agree. Allowing the player to make their own light sources of existing blocks would definitely be a great change to see. No matter how many lighting options are added to the game, options will be limited. This is especially apparent in large, flat areas where hidden lighting is extremely difficult to conceal.

 

The glowstone dust adding light to a block with right click is the perfect solution in my view. It allows players the freedom to fundamentally alter the way they play for the first time. Instead of building their buildings around light, they would now be able to build light around their builds. This is because they'd no longer have to be concerned about fitting in lighting in certain areas like they do now to make a build safe. There would still be a cost to do that (the glowstone dust) but it opens up an entirely new avenue and way to thinking about building in Minecraft that I think is sorely needed.

 

I've made a video here about this exact topic. I hope Mojang considers some of the ideas presented there.

They need to add the "light_block"'s from the Bedrock version to Java, they are awesome! They are invisible, but can emit a custom light level (reaching from 0 to 15). They should show an icon, just like the barrier does, if you hold it, unlike it currently does in Bedrock. They also maybe should be invincible, only breakable using such a light holding in your hand.

I think the glow squid should drop the item that makes any block glow. This would give a use to it, and wouldn't be overpowered if you need nine of them or something, and if it is really rare in those big underwater caves.

I disagree with having quartz in the overworld, quartz is unique to the nether and it needs to stay that way. If you want rose quartz to be a rare nether ore, though, then that's different. I'd be up for that.
Ohh yes very nice
I agree with macchu. Quartz is nether exclusive. It would also make sense as for it to be pink, there would need to be a red color (Netherrack) mixed with white (quartz).
I totally agree with this idea. It would also help to explain why Diorite and Granite use quartz in their crafting recipe. But the veins should be smaller than in the Nether.

Here's how I see it. Rose Quartz should only be found in the Nether since quartz originated from there and it would be another rare material to find. What would make Rose quartz even more unique is it having the ability to slowly regenerate one's health.
totally makes sense, but they should change the texture around the block making it stone.

Rose Quartz Pink would be a desirable colour for Armour Trim. It would also be brilliant to have pink cyrstals to place just as you can with Amethyst and to have as blocks to build with like a Pink Marble in Texture as we have no pink stone at present to build with or use.

In my survival world, I have been searching for wind burst for at least 4 hours. Instead of wind burst, I got 5 heavy cores, around 6 stacks of breeze rods, and every single other trail chambers exclusive item. I didn't even get a single wind burst book. The rarity on this thing is unreal.

Completely agreed. I opened over 50 vaults without getting the enchantment then said screw it and made multiple copies of the world and opened the vault in every single one, even that took 20+ tries but finally got it. Incredibly frustrating and unfair.
I’ve been to 14 trial chambers and looted 80 ominous vaults this is outrageous it is either a bug or it has a less than 2%chance to drop

Is the loot determined when the vault is generated or when it is opened? I’ve got 2 ominous vaults close to each other and I’ve been copying the world, opening them both, then exit, copy the original again and repeat. I’ve opened them well over 50 times each and gotten everything except the wind burst book. Thats not including other ominous vaults I opened before i found those 2

The loot tables really need to be rebalanced. The enchantment is not so good that it justifies being this difficult to obtain. I've been to probably 15 trial chambers and still have not come across a single book for wind burst. These trial chambers are a chore now, instead of a fun place to get decent loot. Most of the loot is really not that good.

I agree, took me many ominous vault to get a heavy core to later realized I have to get back there finding wind burst enchants...

This enchant is too niche to be worth the hassle, specially for late game players where 99% of the loot is worthless. Considering the vault gives the 3 levels of Wind Burst, so if you're lucky enough to have an enchant and get can get it just level 1....

The enchant needs a way higher drop rate, or make the enchant available for regular vault (since it can only enchant the mace, you still need to do an ominous anyway).

Why aren't people talking about this more? It's stupidly rare for an enchantment book especially that you can only open vaults for a limited amount. Seriously, if they want to keep this odds, they should at least make the vaults be reopened infinitely.

I completely agree with this. I've now searched more than 20 chambers now, and not a single wind burst book.

This is irritating because in the bedrock patch notes, they specifically said you cannot time the vaults to get specific rewards. But it literally happens every time you unlock one. And here you see people guessing the right time on the enchanted book and they get it, SPONTANEOUSLY.

SO HERE WE ARE, STARING AT OMINOUS VALUTS TRYING TO TIME IT JUST RIGHT. And it's the most irritating thing ever. It's more like a waste of time...
Unfortunately.
It's not Just too rare, it's too rare and you have to get it FOUR TIMES for the maximum enchantment level because it only drops at level one. That is OBSCENE.
This is so true; I've been looking everywhere for this enchantment, and it's been forever.

I personally loot a lot of trial chambers over last year on a server , and get wind burst 3 and wind burst 2 maces , but when i pushing to get the last needed wind burst book to get level 3 , i loot trial chambers for over 8 hours and get none , so its just totaly luck based , but its really worth it because its super op for pvp.
I hope it’s not as rare as pigstep
GET MORE PEOPLE TO VOTE FOR THIS. I NEED IT
Yo you’re supposed to read the considered ideas before posting feedback. It’s literally confirmed that that won’t be added. Or at least it’s VERY unlikely.

I like this concept and have thought about how useful it would be as a builder myself and I think the staining could be implemented best as a crafting recipe of 8 wood configured like a chest with a dye in the center, because I know some people who would run around with dye and just paint everything similar to log stripping. That would pose an issue. So crafting it instead would be best

Considering the number of block colors and wood variations that would have to be considered to make Stained Wood possible, it seems highly unlikely it would ever happen. However, if the lightest color of wood (Birch) had a staining option, I think that alone would good enough.
I wish they would reconsider this idea. It would make building stuff so much better

Stained wood should only be craftable from a stripped log or wood of any tree variety (not from Nether fungus). Eight stripped logs/wood surrounding a dye would yield eight "Stripped DYE COLOR Log" or "Stripped DYE COLOR Wood". Texture would be dyed Oak, regardless of wood variant used, e.g., stained doors and trapdoors would match Oak Doors and Oak Trapdoors in style. All subsequent crafting with the stained logs would replace the word "Oak" with the name of the dye color, e.g., "Magenta Slab". Items such as sticks, ladders, chests, etc., that have no wood specification, would be craftable but would not be stained.

I think this is a great idea, and like someone else said, I think it would be best implemented with birch wood, since not many people like it or use it, it's the lightest colored wood, and would give it more uses and make players have to use it if they wanted stained wood. Maybe a new village could even be added due to the new variation, like a painted birch forest village or something
I think this is a great idea and i there should also be an alteritive to stain bricks aswell, red ones are a bit borring
so if I put it on my boots I can correctly call them sneakers? You got my vote!

Cool idea, you've got my vote. However, I think that it is important that no matter how strong you are that the warden is still going to be a challenge and I think the devs would agree. It's meant to feel like you are starting all over again, they even compared it to their first night in the game, so making the player invisible to the warden would take away from the experience. Although I think shortening the range a tad from which they can hear you from would be cool.
maybe the sneak enchantment has a chance to be dropped by the warden
It should lower mob detection range too, so it allow players to sneak past other mobs too.
I don't necessarily agree with Sneaking III being undetectable, but all the rest is great.
While I think this is a cool idea I definitely think that being completely invisible to the warden would be very over powered
you better put this in the next update of minecraft for sure

I have an idea called Echo locate. You enchant it to your helmet, and maybe it would only work on metal helmets like copper, iron, and gold, maybe netherite.

Echo locate I
Things that make sound near you (10 blocks) will be lightly highlighted through walls, only works in the dark, or in very low light areas (redstone torches, moonlight, magma block, etc) also if you have blindness.

Echo locate II
Is just a better version of the other one, add 5 more blocks of detection

Echo locate III
adds 5 More blocks of detection

Echo locate IV
adds 10 more blocks of detection

Echo locate V
When you walk all things near you will be highlighted slightly (blocks, fences, even trip wires) so you can see where your going in the dark, enemies near you (regardless if they make sound) will be highlighted through walls very lightly in a 10 block radius, and things that make noise will be detected from the same 30 blocks like in echo locate IV. It still only works in the dark, or when you have blindness.

Players and mobs with sneak will not be detectable.
im thinking about that too.
A lot of people have said this would be a good idea.   I agree.   It seems like a logical next step.

I'm afraid that this wont happen even though i really like the idea giving the fletching table a use expanding further in the whole upgrade idea of different tools and armor pieces. And since i also think the range of the crossbow should be wayy further it fits the theme of a real dedicated long range weapon but only if the crossbow gets a buff in distance or projectile speed and drop off
I am all for this. EMINKAY, why not?

I was literally thinking about the same thing

It would also be cool if you could turn on the "Aiming mode" by pressing Shift
I do think this feature is needed because if you are attacking a hostile mob, like a witch, you have to go up to her/him and kill it.
Well said! I've been wanting this as a feature ever since Fire Charges came to Console. Hope the votes escalate on this one.
You're able to do this in skywars, and ghasts have had an advantage for like 5 years.  so why not make it so you can throw them? i like it.
I think it would be more balanced if it was like a blaze fireball, where it only sets the mob on fire and appears smaller when thrown.
Personally, I'd like them not to explode but just light things on fire like when you place them. Makes it less unbalanced than your idea, especially with farms for each material needed to make one.

I would have said that the firecharge should have no gravity. The firecharges of the ghast have no gravity either. And it should also be stackable. However, it would make sense to add a delay. Similar to the ender pearl.

I fully agree with you, fire charges are really cool and I would love to wield them in battle, it would also be beneficial when dealing with mass mobs or players, as Minecraft does not currently have an explosive projectile, it would also be the center of many dope plays

To sum up the general consensus of most in this comment thread, and to add a few of my own:

Fire charges should stack to 16x instead of 64x. They should act like Blaze fireballs rather than Ghasts'; that is, they do not explode, and instead do 3-4 damage (1-2 less than a Blaze), lighting the block or entity it makes contact with on fire for the same duration. They should not have gravity, as regular fire charges shot from dispensers and Blazes act.
This definitely should be added along with the coal in the crafting repice going away or being replaced with a ghast tear instead

I do think a fire charge should be craftable into a grenade. IMO , a fire charge, several gunpowder, and an ender pearl or something should make a non-stackable item that throws further than a splash potion and does immense damage like tnt.
This idea takes on even more strength now that wind charges exist. Would it be correct for both to have a similar use for combat. Is it considered magic?
Or they can work like wind charges and blaze fire balls. The recipie does make 3, the exact amount that a blaze shootz
Couldn't you already place basalt sideways?
I love the side textures of ancient debris and would be a interesting building material if it could be placed sideways.
And also Blackstone (not Gilded). It has on top and bottom a variation of basalt top and bottom texture. So, it also should be directional.

I would love for the nether to have climbing vegetation, and the potential damage is a good idea! An additional idea would be to have animation a little like with sea grass, so that the vines would look creepy and alive.
Minecraft.gamepedia now has something similar to this shown growing in the red netherwart forest!
I think the vines should be charcoal black but good idea
Very much agree that we should be allowed to have more than 6 patterns.
Yes!  A few more patterns and banners would be much better

Agreed! There are several banner design
ideas that I got very close to perfecting, but would need to add at least one more pattern for them to be complete, and therefore will never be able to finish them, as 6 isnt enough slots.
Raise it to 100, high enough not to be annoying, low enough not to be exploited for lag
That would definitely lead to data banning

I think that an overhaul of the banner making system would be great, like a mini pixel art painter by collecting dyes and using them like paints (with durability) on the interface, with no limits as long as you have enough dye.

Also, if custom patterns could be made by adding something like a printing press and printing frames with durability, that would be so cool as well.

I literally just wanted to make simple poker card suits on a banner and everything is misaligned, so I'm peeved. I just want free form banner making :(
What do you need to make the potion?  Do you just look like the creature, or do you get other abilities too?
Moved to Blocks, Tools, Items and updated header.

This seems really impractical, shouldn't there be some advantage or disadvantage to being an animal.

also what happens to your inventory, is it still accessible?

I'd say it is a silly idea. but its seem to be overpowered. Imagine being a ghast firing fireballs everywhere, become a wither and grief everyone, and enderdragon and knocking everyone too far.

It is also a cool idea, but overpowered. I am not contradicting your idea, just saying...

maybe some good and bad effects depending on mob:

- you are the size of the mob (both helpful and hurtful depends)

- (fun feature that i feel would be funny) being able to talk to whatever mob you turned into

- the creatures have a certain "dumbness" factor or something (this would change your ability to craft, identify items by name, or just not being able to use certain tools.)

- you have vision of that mob (such as the wolf's snout is covering up part of the screen, and whatever color blindness or inverted vision or whatever that mob has. and different mobs see different render distances)

- (idk how this would work) maybe you could get tamed by other players if your a tamable mob

- if you try to chat as mob it comes out as like "woof woof" or whatever your mob is (unless the other player your talking to is same mob, then they can tell what your saying)

- you can breed yourself with mobs of what you morphed into.

- you should't be able to wear armor (unless mob is like zombie, skeleton, etc) (if mob morph is like horse or donkey, then you wear horse armor or something)

- you gain abilities of mob (such as zombies burning in fire, but also such as spiders climbing walls)

- if your a hostile mob, other hostile mobs wont attack you, unless you attack them)

- if your a cow, beef will poison you (this goes for other mobs)

- if your a villager, then other villagers give you some good deals.

- if your like a dog, then villagers think your cute and give you free food.

- if your a cow you can milk yourself.

- if your a chicken you lay eggs.

- if your a sheep you can shear yourself and eat grass.

- if your like a zombie pigman and you get attacked by a player, all other zombie pigman in the area will try to help.

some extra things when transforming could be:

- you may transform slowly (random parts of mob pop out in a time frame of around 30 seconds, this would be exclusive to stuff like dogs. zombies and stuff of that nature would be a little to close to player to have an animation.)

- you get nausea before you transform completely

- you get really hungry after transforming

also the potion would be achieved by:

- a invisibility potion mixed with whatever the mob you want to become dropped

- A witch hut (they are pretty useless right now)

sorry this is such a long comment.
I love this idea. You made a great suggestion! 😁
It should be called a Shifter Potion.
Perfect Idea, I agree, witch hunts are very useless, and witches can be farmed by capping a ton of villagers and getting them struck by lightning, so this could balance it out

or even just a powered version of yourself, like an iron golem version of you. Climb walls, shoot webs, jump high and glide, eat enemies, you get slightly larger, and can walk up 1 block like horses, throw a block, super sprint, night vision, invis, spikes you can shoot that do over time poison damage. All they would have to do is make one of the ingredients needed to craft it wither dust or something rare. I like this
It should be brewed out of an invisibility potion since it is just a more powerful invisibility potion.
Turning into an axolotl or blaze would be cool. Turn into a creeper and blow up your friends. ;)

Another option would be to have another item frame recipe that uses glass.  It's visible when no item is in it (to keep them from getting lost), but would turn invisible when an item is placed inside.

A possible recipe would be to replace the leather of a normal recipe with a glass pane.

To make them more convenient for labeling chests with, how about items can't be rotated in these invisible item frames? (or maybe just if they're placed on an inventory?)

Also have it so that when you click on the item you can either make the item flat or make it 3D like it would normally look. That would be nice if you wanna decorate a store with display items or you just wanna make your house look less bare.
I think it would be nice if each Item had it's own 3D placed texture similar to the Placeable Items mod.
It would be nice to place down your food, or sword,potion,goodies, (extedire extedire)
Yes, I’m glad someone agrees! I want to be able to set glass bottles and bowls down.

Item frames should be invisible or at least be able to change the color of them based on type of wood used to make them. In bedrock I had a data pack that made them invisible, but it's out of date now. It was a great feature. I thought it was announced as a feature coming in 1.16?

this does deserve more thought. I mean, this is one of the reasons why lots of people download mods and Addons. because they think the game itself is boring. Have you ever just wanted to place you pumpkin pie down? I have! Another idea is that witch huts spawn with placed bottles with this kind of update. It would definitely add to the witch theme of the hut! Although, there are problems with it. LDShadowLady demonstrates that in one of her videos, when she places down her bow due to a mod, fighting mobs. Just something I wanted to mention. This is very good for creative when you wanna make a house, and you’re into decorating. Same with survival. LOTS of players love decor, including myself. So I think this would be a very good update, but it’s the players fault if they place down their sword while fighting the wither because of this suggestion.
Good idea! I have lots of problems when building because of this. At least items should be able to be placed on the top of a block.
This feature would allow redstone engineers control the economy. That's why i am voting for it.
This would seriously expand the possibilities you can do with redstone in Minecraft. Hope it gets added :)
This block will introduce a new mechanic that will not only allow for the creation of automatic farms but also fill the gap with a purely decorative item such as goat horns
wow
Good
Oh, how I love astronomy, I’ll definitely go to minecraft if they add it, this spiritual update needs to be added
It would be very interesting to see this in minecraft
Very good
We need this in Minecraft, pleaaaseeeeee!
I voted to idea a tetraflower
Wow i think thats a realy realy good idea
Wow i think thats a realy realy good idea
I really think this idea is cool! Maybe don't require another ingot to make the new helmet though, as this seems kind of overpriced.

@ ProGameEnder337

I don’t think that the idea will appear. maybe you're right, we need to think about another version of reforging on the forge table.
They already have a unique shape for netherite Armor, so why not take the shapes of armor a step further
That's cool! I agree this is a pretty good idea

Cauldron
lets be honest they have no use other than to look nice. it would be nice to have an early beacon, puttng flowers in the water and then lighting a fire underneath allowing the natural magic to steam into the air. it would take about 5 minutes for the water to completly boil away and be empty but the play would get a small benefit in a small area of range.

Totems
Im not saying let us make totems of undying because the woodland mannor is a fun dungeon but let use make some smaller totems, perhaps a totem of cat that would make creepers scared of us or one the would cure us of a potion effect when we get attacked. of course these would break over time (cat totem) or instantly (potion) when being held but it would be nice to have a natural magic garden to keep these items coming.

Crystals

Crystals would be rare to find deep in caves but they could be used to create stronger golems (im not talking diamond golems or anything just iron ones that might be faster or have more health depending on the crytal they are made with) or maybe some earth magic making rituals with red stone and crystals on the ground that cause a storm to come or go. even allowing us to make a ritual site around a pool of water so when you are in the water it heals you.

Crafting
some basic elemental staves, the best one I can think of is air. using it channels it and pushing other players, mobs and arrows away from you, whilst channeling you also have slowfall so you can drop of a mountain and use your magic to gide down, giving us an alter to make these staves and totems would be awsome, again all the staves would break unless repaired with materials and XP.
also just some basic things like

bandages
a herb basket
animal hide armour (like polar bear fur armour)
some blade oils (these would give enchantments like 'smite' but for only three strikes)
some tipped arrows that aren't end game materials

Biome Magic
because each biome has different flowers, soils (and hey even crystals if you add them) make each one do something unique, some flowers may make natural bandages stronger and be more desired. this gives a player a reason to adventure out and gather things from around their world. it also opend up alot of server options too, imagine players trading with those from another biome for their magical resources or even server built around witch hunts.

I hate to disagree but I think that would kind of be a bit op to have that kind of power, just saying if you where to get all that power you would easily go through mobs leaving the game a little dull, plus there is already potions and the totem of undying, but it is still a great idea and I would love to see something similar to this... like a potion that could let you freeze mobs or players in place for a moment when punch them with your free hand making it not too overpowered of a trick because potions have time limits
I disagree because it would ruin the feel of Minecraft's natural game-style. It makes it where it isn't as natural and ruins the fun of surviving in your own world, full of adventure.
I really think there should be mana, which would power magic spells, and mana could be an ore so there's more reason to mine underground.

This is be a great idea, but what if in order to make a small totem you'll need a hay bale and a drop from the mob or a haunted block. A haunted block would be a block that the mob died on. Using a hay bale and the block would give you the totem. Also side note the stronger the block is the more durability it has with the most being 20 or 25.

We need a whole update related to magic if you ask me. Minecraft needs a more broad stretch of fighting styles. It would be really cool if Minecraft had different “categories” that you could pick from and upgrade. So maybe instead of having regular armor, you could sacrifice wearing a chest plate for a cloak that allows you to slow fall on command or maybe you could wear a pair of boots that allow you to double jump without having the ability to use feather falling. There are so many great ideas that people have related to magic and the whole combat system in general. Fingers crossed that Mojang will make some awesome changes to the combat system.
